sources.why: Miami-Dade County septic system records and permits
Florida DOH records that may contain septic tank location information

linkable_points: Professional septic tank location services use electronic locators, ground-penetrating radar, and specialized probing equipment to find buried tanks
Tank location typically costs $100-$300 in Miami-Dade, depending on property size, access difficulty, and equipment needed
Knowing your tank location is essential for maintenance, repairs, and preventing damage during landscaping or construction projects
Miami's high water table and sandy/limestone soils can make tank location more challenging than in other areas
Many older properties have lost records of tank location, making professional location services necessary for safe access
Accurate tank location prevents expensive damage to tanks and drain fields during digging or excavation work
Professional locators provide detailed reports including tank depth, lid locations, and access recommendations
Locating tanks before pumping, inspection, or repairs saves time and reduces costs for maintenance work

competitors.notes: Most septic contractors offer location services as part of maintenance or inspection visits

cost_methodology: Ranges commonly reported by Miami-Dade licensed contractors. Costs vary based on property size, soil conditions, and equipment needed.
local_factors: Miami's high water table can make probing and excavation more difficult
Sandy soils and limestone bedrock affect which location methods work best
Heavy vegetation and landscaping common in Miami can obscure visual clues
Many older Miami properties lack accurate records of tank locations
